adjective.description: Causing great horror or fear; frightful or macabre.
examples: she was overcome with horror at the ghastly spectacle
he always felt ghastly first thing in the morning
we had to wear ghastly old-fashioned dresses

origin: Middle English: from obsolete gast terrify, from Old English gǣstan, of Germanic origin; related to ghost. The gh spelling is by association with ghost. The sense objectionable dates from the mid 19th century.
